page.title: 09REV J THOROLD-FLYING VICAR
page.content: The Rev. Thorold was first called the flying Vicar by a reporter from the Times newspaper.He came to interview him because he serves ten parishes.As the flying vicar he finds himself in many different places.For instance he often goes to the old peoples home in Spilsby,then he will take a funeral in another village,then on to another village to visit a sick person.In the evening he has a Parochial Church Meeting He finds his job very interesting and stimulating.He received his call to the ministry,while he was a market gardener,when a Fraciscan monk was preaching.He has one curate to help him in his work.A typical Sunday would be:- 8-00 Holy Communion,Spilsby.10-00 Family Service,Halton.11-00 H.C., Hundleby. 1-15 Gables Hospital.6-30 Evening Prayer,Spilsby.8-00 Hospital.
